intro: Ledebouria mokobulanensis, commonly known as the Mokobula bulbous lily, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its compact rosette of thick, fleshy leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale green in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in botanical collections.
